Patent Information.Abstract: The present invention provides methods of designing and making structurally stabilized anti-microbial peptides for the prophylaxis and treatment of infection. Methods are also disclosed for designing stabilized anti-microbial peptides that are selectively lytic/cytotoxic to bacteria, allowing for internal use of anti-microbial peptides without mammalian membrane disruption and cytotoxicity.

Sequence Information.Family: Belongs to the frog skin active peptide family (Caerin subfamily)
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Function: Antibacterial peptide, that adopts an alpha helical conformation which can disrupt bacterial membranes. Each caerin displays a different antimicrobial specificity.
Sequence Information.Tissue specificity: Expressed by the skin dorsal glands.
Sequence Information.Domain: Contains two amphipathic alpha helix regions separated by a region of less-defined helicity and greater flexibility (By similarity).

Literature.Title: New antibiotic caerin 1 peptides from the skin secretion of the Australian tree frog Litoria chloris. Comparison of the activities of the caerin 1 peptides from the genus Litoria.
Literature.Author: Steinborner ST, Currie GJ, Bowie JH, Wallace JC, Tyler MJ.
